On 9/10/07, Jeff Langr <jeff@...> wrote:

> Quoting C=E9dric Beus=
t ? <cbeust@...>:
>  > Just like everything else, use TDD sparingly.=

>
>  This is perhaps great advice for a very experienced developer, someon=
e
>  who has the prescience to know when they are about to write perfect
> =
 code.
>
>  Otherwise, for someone just starting out and learning TDD, I'd =
suggest
>  trying to first learn how to grow solutions incrementally before=

>  deciding it's not their style.

Agreed.  I think TDD is a great learnin=
g tool for beginners, and I
definitely encourage Yang Gu to keep experiment=
ing.  I also think he
should not dismiss what his friends are saying and th=
at in a few
months, he'll be able to either prove them wrong or come to the=
 same
conclusion they did.
